basics.name: Abigail Lorber

basics.summary: I am a Junior at UH Mānoa seeking a B.S. in Computer Science. I expect to graduate Spring 2026.

work.summary: Alternate semesters of work and school (delayed graduation to Spring 2026).

work.position: Girls in Tech Summer Camp Mentor
work.summary: Mentored girls ages 13-17 at a summer camp hosted by Hawai'i Pacific University.
highlights: Advocated for women in Computer Science.
Prepared and planned daily activities with a team; focused on integrating Hawaiian culture into activities.
Learned about culturally responsive pedagogy and interacting with students in ways that are culturally meaningful and inclusive.

work.summary: Watched students during lunch and recess time.
highlights: Supervised recess and creative art activities; created fun and engaging activities for students.
Managed and set classroom expectations to maintain a calm and productive learning environment.

volunteer.summary: Pack boxes for elderly and/or children.

highlights: Cared and played with animals; cleaned cages and provided fresh food/water.
Advised applicants about the animals and the adoption process.
Advocated for the SPCA and the animals.
